conclusion: Analyzing Liquid Flow Paths: Liquids flow from containers A, B, and C at the top, and need to determine which bottom containers (D, E, or F) they will ultimately flow into.
Each liquid appears to flow downward and can interact with the colored bars (baffles) placed diagonally on the board.
Pink liquid starts flowing straight down from container A.
Pink liquid encounters the yellow baffle first and follows along it.
Pink liquid continues downward after the yellow baffle.
Pink liquid flows down to the right side of the board.

premise: Pink liquid flows down to the right side of the board.
conclusion: The pink liquid from A appears to flow into container F.
Green liquid flows straight down from container B.
Green liquid encounters the yellow baffle and follows along it toward the right.
Green liquid reaches the end of the yellow baffle and continues downward.
Green liquid merges with the blue liquid (from Container C) at the lower right.

premise: Green liquid merges with the blue liquid at the lower right.
conclusion: The green liquid flows into container G.
Blue liquid flows straight down from container C.
Blue liquid follows a relatively straight path downward.
Blue liquid moves toward the right side of the board.

premise: Blue liquid moves toward the right side of the board.
conclusion: The blue liquid eventually flows into container G, merging with the green liquid.
